episode_summary: This episode features discussions on unusual facts about Waitrose in Tumbridge Wells, a Zimmer frame amnesty in Scotland, a controversy at the Liars Club Lie of the Year award, and bizarre crisp flavors including Arthur Scargill and vagina. The hosts are joined by guest Richard Osman.

facts.fact: Tumbridge Wells does not have a Waitrose.
After successful amnesties on knives and guns in 2016, a Scottish council offered an amnesty on Zimmer Frames.
In 2010, the annual Liars Club Lie of the Year award was marred with controversy when the winning liar was accused of having lied about his lie.
Unusual crisp flavours in history include prosecco, fish curry, buttered garlic scallop, vagina, and Arthur Scargill.
